page.title: 17WHERE I LIVE
page.content: Our estate is made up of two different kinds of houses ,private and council. On our estate there are five streets and a lane . The lane and three of the streets are all council houses and the other two are council and private. The names of the streets are Freeston drive, Freeston avenue ,Church avenue, Woodland avenue, Park avenue and Kirkthorpe lane. There are about one hundred and fifty houses on our estate.On our estate there is one shop, the shop sells almost everything from sweets to fishing nets. Across from the shop there is acommunity centre with a field at the side. Centred around Kirkthorpe church are many converted farm buildings which have made atractive stone dwellings. The cheesecake Inn situated adjacent to half moon lane was visited by Dick Turpin the highway man.
